args.content:
import Mathlib
open BigOperators
open Matrix

/--
If A ‚àà O(n) is written as A = [A‚ÇÅ | A‚ÇÇ | ‚Ä¶ | A‚Çô] with A_i ‚àà ‚Ñù^n, then the columns are orthonormal.
Equivalently, the dot product of distinct columns is 0 and of a column with itself is 1.
-/
theorem orthogonal_matrix_columns_orthonormal {n : ‚Ñï} (A : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ‚Ñù) (h : IsOrthogonal A) :
  ‚àÄ i j : Fin n, (‚àë k : Fin n, A k i * A k j) = if i = j then 1 else 0 := by sorry
